 Ademas si no traes mucho presupuesto aqui encuentras comida muy variada y rica, si te cuidas de no comer tanto irritante puedes pedir un filete de pescado o si no un Mole o como las tradicionales enchiladas al estilo Guanajuato, !hay tanta variedad, que no sabes que comer! mis amigas dicen que el menudo lo hacen muy rico."

Title: "Comer rico y barato"
Opinion: "Si quieres comer rico y barato, tu opción es el mercado hidalgo en el centro de Guanajuato, en especial las tortas italianas o cubanas, mmmm…"

Title: "Mercado de maravillas"
Opinion: "La estructura del mercado está a la vista del visitante. En este lugar se encuentran desde alimentos tradicionales hasta bellos recuerdos que plasman la riqueza cultural de Guanajuato."

Title: "Se me hace bonito estar aquín y ver todo lo que hay y toda la gente"
Opinion: "Venden de todo aquí. Es grandísimo y alegre ir aquí y hayas de todo. Ropa, artesanos, dulces ect. Parece que pizza es un especialidad de la región. ¡Voy a regresar!"

Title: "Beautiful, full of colors"
Opinion: "We didn't go to shop but just to view the vendors and take pictures from above on the second level. The building is quite original and worth your time."

Title: "¡De compras!"
Opinion: "Si te gustan las compras en los mercados, y oir de la gente regateando por el mejor precio, no dejes de visitarlo, ademas ahi puedes encontrar los mejores souvenirs de la zona."

Title: "Visita gastronómica y artesanal obligada"
Opinion:
"Este bello inmueble construido en el ocaso del Porfiriato y con motivo de la celebración del centenario de la Independencia de México es sin duda el mas bello en su tipo de México.

En su planta baja se venden frutas, verduras etc. y en la planta alta se puede disfrutar de gastronomía mexicana y adquirir artesanías."

Title: "An OK place to say "I saw it"
Opinion: "In a cool building, the market inside is crowded and not nearly as pleasant as shopping for the same items outdoors. Thousands of "tourist trap" items, many made in Guatemala, and a place to by lunch, meat, or produce. The locals we met advised against buying meat there, however."

Title: "¡Tortas de carnitas!"
Opinion: "Es un mercado clásico en un edificio colonial, pero lo califico excelente porque me comí una torta de carnitas deliciosa; te lo sirven en un bolillo suavecito (no como los de Guadalajara que son crujientes) pero las carnitas, deliciosas. Espero que los Michoacanos no se ofendan, pero las carnitas casi tan buenas como las de Quiroga, Michoacan."

Title: "Que gran colorido"
Opinion: "Llegar a este lugar es como magia, no sabes ni para donde voltear, según vas a buscar unas cuantas cosas y al final ya no sabes que llevarte de tantas cosas bonitas que hay en ese lugar. Mmm como que hay que llevar bastantillo $"

Title: "Inside does not live up to the magnificent entrance..."
Opinion:
"From the outside you would feel that you are in for an experience such as entering the glass market building in Valencia Espana; but you are doomed for dissappointment.
The local Council has not done anything to this place in 25 years and it does not live up to your expectations. It badly needs a new roof... something to live up to the promise of the entrance. Inside there is a lot of cubicles, but merely one third of them are open and the alleyways are clogged with empty cartons etc. This place has been badly neglected and there are a 100 better market experiences to be had elsewhere in Mexico."

Title: "Nothing special but a cheap place to eat and buy souvenirs"
Opinion: "There is nothing spectactular about the Hidalgo Market, however, it is stocked with many basic items you would expect to see in a Mexican market. There are a number of cheap eating places which serve fairly decent fare. In addition, you can buy local talavera, leather goods from Leon, vegetables, and spices. Definitely worth a visit if you want to buy some gifts for those back home."

Title: "Okay market"
Opinion: "Nothing outstanding. Produce and meats downstairs, and trinkets upstairs, but nothing of great quality. Reasonably clean."

Title: "Un mercado cualquiera"
Opinion: "Más bonito el exterior que el interior. La fachada es muy bonita, pero el interior es como cualquier mercado."

Title: "Buena"
Opinion: "Se me hiso algo normal por lo menso en el peusto que selecione me parecio asi y apesar de que eramos poca gente no nos atendieron bien."

Title: "Se come rico"
Opinion: "Hay una marisqueria atendida por la dueña Doña que atiende muy bien y sirve abundantes porciones y a muy buen precio, se los recomiendo, también hay una señora que se pone en la puerta que da a la salida donde están las fondas, que vende quesos deliciosos, fresquesitos y baratos."

Title: "Decepción"
Opinion: "Realmente lo había visitado antes y ha perdido esplendor,está muy sucio,en mal estado,poco que ver."

Title: "Market"
Opinion: "Fruit, vegetables, chicken, meat, etc. downstairs. Cheapo souvenirs upstairs. Don't expect to see anything unique or handmade."

Title: "Una joya"
Opinion: "Es un gozo visitar este lugar, pocos lugares en el mundo pueden presumir una construcción de Eiffel, no te vayas de Guanajuato sin visitarlo. Sólo valdría la pena luchar por estar mas limpio."

Title: "Every city in Mexico has a mercado like this"
Opinion: "It is smaller than most, but all the standard butchers, green-grocers, and street vendors are represented here. The torta carnitas are the best reason to visit!"

Title: "Sin chiste"
Opinion: "Sin chiste, sucio, sólo un mercado, huele mal, aunque está colorido."

Title: "Lugar de tradición"
Opinion: "El visitar este mercado me hizo sentir que en mexico existe una gran tradicion por este tipo de establecimientos los mercados en nuestro pais es parte de nuestras tradiciones."

Title: "Visita obligada en Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Bonito y pintoresco, lleno de artesanías típicas a buen precio."

Title: "El mercado más orginal"
Opinion: "Me encanta el mercado de Guanajuato. Cuando era niña era un lugar de ley, no importa cuántas veces vayas, siempre es divertido ver el movimiento de gente, los puestos, comprar artesanias muy baratas y tradicionales, a los niños les encanta ver tanta chuchería. Comida fresca abajo para desayunar o almorzar. Y por supuesto el edificio tan orginal para un mercado. Es un lugar inperdible si vas a Guanajuato."

Title: "Muy típico"
Opinion: "Las enchiladas mineras algo barbáro, lleno de artesanias un sitio imperdible en Guanajuato."

Title: "Mercado muy pintoresco"
Opinion: "Es un lugar perfecto para ir a comprar un recuerdito de guanajuato, algun dulce tradicional como las charamuscas y tambien para comer, era una antigua estacion de trenes y esta muy bonita su estructura externa."

Title: "Just a tourist attraction!"
Opinion: "Its a good "Kodak Moment" and the tragic story of the lovers but its a moment's stop for picture taking."

Title: "Great market"
Opinion: "A little bit of everything here. Gracious venders, no hassles. Had fun buying fruit for the house and fixings for guacamole, all with lots of smiles. There are great places for my favorite shrimp cocktail and upstairs there's a vendor in the corner who sells great pottery at reasonable prices."

Title: "My favorite market in Mexico"
Opinion: "It is very well kept. It does not smell. It is worth walking threw."

Title: "Que belleza de arquitectura"
Opinion: "He ido a Guanajuato muuuchas veces en mi vida, y en diferentes épocas, ya sea por distracción, por trabajos de la Maestría, por pasar un rato fuera de lo normal, etc., Y siempre me ha encantado ir allí a ver las curiosidades que ofrecen, ya sea en dulces, artesanía, candiles, juguetitos (no para mí), antigüedades. pinturas (litografías), etc."

Title: "Dolores Hidalgo, una ciudad que recomiendo visitarla"
Opinion: "Destacar del mercado los excelentes "helados" y sin lugar a dudas visitar el cementerio y concretamente la tumba del famoso canto autor José Alfredo Jiménez."

Title: "También puede comida a un precio razonable"
Opinion: "Tenía que decirle al conductor, quien se le preguntó a recoger en el aeropuerto. México Mercado es el caso en algunos lugares no muy limpio, pero este mercado es un aseado, hay muchas tiendas que se puede comer en la barra. Tuve la sopa en la tienda de productos del mar, pero contiene un gran buque, como una cuenca, es muy delicioso para comer y exprimir el limón. Sin embargo, por favor, preste de seguro, ya que no está escrito por precio."

Title: "Fuchi, fuchi pero…"
Opinion: "El edificio por fuera es muy bello, tiene una arquitectura hermosa, pero el interior es sucio y los vendedores suelen ser muy groseros y venden la mercancía carísima. Sólo conocí una sola vendedora en la parte de arriba del Mercado Hidalgo (entrando, tomas las escaleras de la izquierda, en la esquina 1) que fue amable."

Title: "Recuerditos típicos"
Opinion: "Este monumento funciona como mercado municipal :( pienso que debería estar mejor resguardado, en fin, encuentras lo que necesitar para llevarle un recuerdito típico a tus amigos y familiares."

Title: "Worth a quick visit"
Opinion: "Interesting local market, which is a building transported piece by piece from Europe and reassembled here."

Title: "Colorful and Vibrant"
Opinion: "Big city market sells all the food and souvenirs you could ever need."

Title: "Encuentras de todo"
Opinion: "Y que decir de su hermosa cupula traida de francia, simplemente espectacular."

Title: "Mercado Hidalgo"
Opinion: "Muy tradicional gran sabor de provincia enciontre objetos coleccionables para mia memorabilia personal."

Title: "El auténtico mercado mexicano"
Opinion: "Genial, para probar comida, para comprar artesanía, en general para agradar nuestros sentidos."

Title: "Pura tradición"
Opinion: "Pocos mercados mexicanos como este, de entrada al mercado prueba el aguamiel de los originarios de la region.... Excelente."

Title: "Mercadeo a vapor"
Opinion: "Me gusto su entrada, la cual es bella y hace creer que se trata de otro sitio, pero creo le quita belleza el mercadeo al rededor de èl, ojalà reubicaràn a estos comercios, sin quitarles la oportunidad de sus ventas que le ayuda a vivir."

Title: "Market day--whew!"
Opinion: "Lots of activity. Fun to watch from the upper level. lots of locals doing their daily jobs with friendliness and enthusiasm."

Title: "Buen lugar"
Opinion: "El lado de artesanias es magnifico y todo a muy buen precio, hay que poner atencion en la higiene presentacion y forma de preparar los alimentos en los lugares que hai se encuentran."

Title: "Typical market with produce and other things"
Opinion: "A large indoor market, but similar to many others."

Title: ""Pásele marchanta"
Opinion: "siempre es mejor el trato persona a persona,y el mercado hidalgo es lo ideal, ademas de estar limpio y los precios son muy accesibles, me encanta ir con mis hijos y recorrerlo todo. especialmente la plazuela del zapato."

Title: "Se puede comprar el souvenir México aquí"
Opinion: "Momia de Guanajuato especialidades Ameya, se pueden comprar alimentos de primera necesidad, tales como artículos de cuero, como las artesanías una amplia variedad de cosas aquí. Gran edificio con aspecto de depósito es de dos pisos, tiendas pequeñas tienen alrededor. Creo que es bueno no depende de las condiciones meteorológicas, ya hay un techo. Para activar de manera eficiente Guanajuato, se decidió comprar recuerdos aquí, podría ser bueno para estar concentrado en el turismo de la ciudad después."

Title: "El mercado"
Opinion: "Como todos los mercados o la gran mayoria, son lugares pintorescos pero nada mas, no se tiene mayor atraccion."

Title: "Great Food and shopping!"
Opinion: "Loved the chilie relleno tortas! We got so many great deals on great products you cannot find everywhere."

Title: "RECOMMEND MERCADO EMBAJADORES INSTEAD"
Opinion: "Hidalgo is passe even though the structure is wonderful the city has done nothing to improve the inside of it. UNESCO IS POURING MILLIONS INTO THE CITY AND INTO THE POCKETS OF ????"

Title: "Guanajuato today not yesterday"
Opinion: "In a barn like building downhill from the Alhondiga, in contains a two score or more stalls within it, both on the broad open floor and around a balcony above.  The mercado definitely serves locals as much if not more than tourists. Butchers line the walls, busily chopping and dressing. Whole birds and hog's heads are are visible, and the smell of fresh meat is intense. Closer to the center are the grocers and in the middle, forming a spine down th center aisle, are the taquerias that operate inside. Most have stools like a bar and every one had more than one customer. Being a tourist town, there were many souvenir and craft merchants as well, with baskets and pottery and leather goods and bric a brac of universal form.  Even if you do not buy, it is worth the stroll. But you will buy something. The only question is what and for how much."

Title: "Classic Market Building"
Opinion: "Looks like a turn of the last century train station, but it is the central market for the City- the the ground floor has real market items and the upper balcony has every thing a tourist could desire. The Market is interesting but not very crowded."

Title: "Mercado sucio"
Opinion: "Lleno de baratijas locales, pero en mal estadod e higiene, fue la terminal de el ferricarril hace siglos, pero no conserva la belleza de lugares como en París que lo convirtieron en museo, aqui es un vil mercado de artesanias caras."

Title: "Construcción Porfirista"
Opinion: "Disfrutar del espacio y su entrada principal es confortante, lastima que se ocupe para el tipo de comercio que existe en el lugar."

Title: "Lots of goodies"
Opinion: "We happened upon this Market while taking a walk around the area. It's not the biggest market I've seen in Mexico but it had a nice selection of goods from fruit to crafts and the prices were fair. We purchsed a nice looking shirt for my husband and a tourist mug and shot glass for some friends back home. I liked the fact that it was two story as you could walk upstairs to get an overall view of what was available below. The vendors were more laid back than in some markets so I enjoyed that aspect as well since we have been to some markets where the vendors can be very overwhelming and almost pushy to get you to purchase their items. The exterior of the building was also attractive at the front entry way and makes a lovely photo."

Title: "Bello por fuera"
Opinion: "Por fuera tiene una arquitectura bastante agradable al ojo, e imponente por su altura, pero por dentro necesita mantenimiento como casi todos los mercados municipales que conozco. Bueno para comprar artesanías en la parte superior o para tomar un refrigerio en sus locales de abajo."

Title: "Nice enough market"
Opinion: "The market is split into two sections. The downstairs section is mostly produce and food and the upstairs section is tourist stuff. It is your best bet for buying candies and the charamuscas (caramel mummies). Worth visiting, but don´t expect too much."

Title: "Buena imagen por fuera pero dentro nada fuera de lo normal"
Opinion: "Es una edificación llamativa por fuera para ser un mercado, sin embargo no me pareció tan llamativo por dentro, los productos artesanales nada fuera de lo común con respecto a otros lugares de la ciudad, quizás después de conocer mercados muy llamativos como los oaxaqueños o el de San Juan de Dios en Guadalajara ,éste no me gustó mucho, además que ial ir con mi familia, los alrededores me parecieron algo inseguros ya que en algunas ocasiones se nos acercaron tipos de muy mala facha y mejor decidimos subir a un taxi y retirarnos. Aún así hay artesanías muy bonitas en los lugares de procedencia de cada artesanía y boutiques artesanales de productos muy finos elaborados por artistas de la región."

Title: "Variedad"
Opinion: "Me gusto que encuentras de todo desde ropa hasta manualidades curiosidades y tiene muchas escaleras y es inmenso hay mucho que ver."

Title: "The food stalls looked awesome"
Opinion: "Looking back on our trip I regret that we did not eat at the market. The food stalls looked so delcious but, because it was so early in our 3 week trip to Mexico I guess we hesitated since we didn't want to get sick. We ended up eating tons of street food in Morelia and we felt fine the whole time so now I wish we had just done it. The shopping was not any good. The stalls were filled with cheaply made trinkets, which is why I am reviewing this as Just Average."

Title: "Mercado Hidalgo Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Cubrió nuestra necesidad de adquirir algunos alimentos, es bonito y caracteristico de esta hermosa ciudad."

Title: "Mercado"
Opinion: "Es lindo y tradicional de mexico pero no me hizo vibrar."

Title: "Souvenir paradise!"
Opinion: "Be sure to purchase REAL Chocolate de metate at the doorway, the lady sels out quickly so come early… also, love the mexican artisan shop of old toys and figurines in the middle aisle."

Title: "Great market"
Opinion: "Wonderful place to see all thing Mexican. Have lunch at Carnitas Sam's...incredible sandwiches. Ate there each day for lunch."

Title: "Many interesting foods and things to buy!"
Opinion: "Worth it to just wander through the stalls and see all the different foods and crafts. Some of it's crap but there's also some colourful home ceramics and pottery."

Title: "Un mercado único"
Opinion: "Donde encontraras todos los subenirs que quieras y a un excelente precio."

Title: "Go for fun"
Opinion: "Go here for a fun few minutes but to be honest, there was nothing there for us to buy. It has some touristy junk that we completely avoided. The food looked like an interesting possibility but we were eating too much at nice restaurants and didn't want to spoil our appetites."

Title: "Pop in have a look and beat it out of there!"
Opinion: "A messy collection of poor quality cheap goods. Alright for a quick look round and but not much else."

Title: "Skip 2nd floor, stay for the food!"
Opinion: "Not as much unique artisan crafts on the second floor as I would have hoped to see (kitschy tourist trinkets for the part, so you'll have to venture into town for the good stuff) but great selection of food on the ground floor."

Title: "The way it used to be"
Opinion: "If you are old enough to remember what shopping was like in the States before supermarket chains and giant malls you will feel right at home here. Bring your grandkids and show them a window into the past. This converted train station is a crowded jumble of all kinds of merchandise, soup to nuts and everything in between, a great place to just wander and look."

Title: "Design by Eiffel"
Opinion: "Could be much better inside, everything is crowded and dark"

Title: "Joya popular"
Opinion: "Es increible que este monumento se trata de un mercado. En él se puede degustar una gran variedad de platillos típicos ademas de admirar su belleza arquitectónica."

Title: "CARÍSIMO"
Opinion: "Caro, muy caro...precios para turistas, para comida barata MERCADO SAN JUAN DE DIOS!!!"

Title: "Great architecture"
Opinion: "Made by Eiffel I heard, a nice structure for a market. In the heart of the city, hard to miss."

Title: "Pura experiencia"
Opinion: "En definitiva los mejores precios para turistas, es muy buen lugar para regatear y conocer. Excelentes lugares para comer."

Title: "Excelentes platillos mexicanos"
Opinion: "Es un mercado como muchos de los que podemos encontrar en distintos lugares de mexico, lo excepcional de este o lo especial es que hace años solia ser la estacion del ferrocarril y se nota en toda su estructurta desde el momento en que uno entra a este lugar, puedes encontrar todo tipo de platillos mexicanos y artesanias, asi que para ir a desayunar y comprar los regalos para la familia y amigos esta genial, excelente para una visita matutina antes de salir a recorrer las hermosas calles de Guanajuato."

Title: "Las mejores tortas de Guanajuato"
Opinion: "Si bien el mercado es sencillo en sus puestos, nunca olvidare las exquisitas tortas que alli comi. Nada de restaurantes ni fondas, si estas en Guanajuato ve a comer al mercado. NO TE ARREPENTIRAS."

Title: "Quite an experience"
Opinion: "This market is packed tight with food, clothes, chotches. The aisles are very narrow. The customers were on their busy way from work to home."

Title: "Excellent Local Market in Great Old Building"
Opinion: "For those like me who enjoy seeing the local markets when they visit a central American city, this an excellent one with many stalls outside of just fruits and vegetables and there are 2 floors worth in a charming old building, so less cramped than your typical market."

Title: "Must go"
Opinion: "Very nice experience, have a torta de carnitas ( pork sandwich) in the first place you come to with all the people waiting to eat. Cheapest best torat i have had."

Title: "Good eats"
Opinion: "Be sure to visit Tik-Tik to eat, great prices and friendly service."

Title: "Interesante pasillo del mercado"
Opinion: "La sala histórica Mercado Hidalgo es una gran sala ligeramente pomposo de puestos interesantes para los gastos diarios en Lebensmittlen todo fresco y duradero. Es interesante para comprar comida allí, pero inusual para nosotros, los objetos cotidianos mexicanos. Además, un pintoresco oportunidad para tomar fotos, dentro y fuera."

Title: "Eiffel's train station"
Opinion:
"1st floor, for the most part is a neighborhood store/market and very good fast food Mexican style. 2nd floor, they sell odds and ends, cups that say guanajuato, etc. it only takes a few minutes to see what's up there. then you decide if you need a closer look.
part of the french train station/mexican mercado is built over the guanajuato river. it's even interesting underneath in the subterranea padre miguel hidelgo. you can see that they just bolted together eiffel's kit over a bunch of arches spanning the guanajuato river. E-Z to find, just down the street from los angeles plaza where the callejon de beso is."

Title: "Great for people watching and souvenir shopping"
Opinion: "Mercado Hildago was designed by Gustav Eiffel, the same person who designed the Eiffel Tower in Paris. The building is made up of cast iron and is 2 storey high. It is a huge market for all sorts of goods: meat, fish, vegetables, fruit, sandwich shops, craft store, t shirt and souvenir shops etc. I like to see how the locals live and Mercado Hildago is a great place for watching how locals interact with each other. There are lots of souvenirs such as t shirts, postcards and crafts for tourists to purchase. I visited the market on the day before Mexico's Independence Day and so there were a lot of tourists also. Fun place to visit and spend a couple hours."

Title: "Una construcción inusual para un mercado mexicano"
Opinion: "Cuando vi a lo lejos el mercado Hidalgo me pareciò que serìa una construcciòn de tipo religioso, fue grande mi sorpresa al percatarme que se trataba de uno de los màs pintorescos mercados de nuestro paìs. Muy agradable hallazgo."

Title: "A great indoor market"
Opinion: "The building itself is huge and roughly from the turn of the previous century. It's worth some time inside even if you are not in the market for buying anything. Once inside you might find something. There are clothing stands, tourist stuff including t-shirts, fruit and vegie stands, bread, many little stalls for ordering a meal, and many other things for sale. If you just walk around the lower level it will take you a while but go upstairs for some real good looks at the lower level. There is a balcony of shops all along the second floor and we took lots of photos from above at the business of shopping below. The market is perhaps a ten minute walk from the main center of town around the Jardin. Just follow the main street that goes slightly downhill to the market."

Title: "Hay una variedad de artesanías"
Opinion: "Hay una variedad de artesanías. Nada fácil comprar a un bajo costo. Negire una compra completa. Estaba aquí, compré un cuchillo y la cartera, collar de mercurio. Aquí se encuentra el famoso Museo de las Momias, pero cuando la causa podría ser bueno para tratar por aquí también."

Title: "Great sandwiches in the Mercado"
Opinion:
"I first visited the Mercado Hidalgo on my honey moon, Luna de miel in spanish, and WOW .First, it was designed by Eiffel. As a Union Ironworker it is a great thrill for me to see such a grand and majestic aplication of steel,iron and rivets.
 As you walk up to the Mercado Hidalgo from any approach it is swirling in activity. Anything you might be able to carry home after buying you can find...at a bargain. Tools,produce,flowers,pets,fresh cooked foods,movies,household goods,souvenirs,fresh meat and fish. All around are fresh food stands where you can buy an authentic Guanajuato lunch at a bargain price .From the Fondas [small lunch stands] outside where the women running the fondas motion you to come sit down by extending there arms straight and making a motion like a pantomime of an alligator's mouth opening and closing...the first couple times my wife and I saw this we were clueless but it was a great lesson in the difference in cultures.The food at the outside Fonda stands is simple and economical specializing in typical regional food.This is the working persons fare...the Mexicano equavalant of steak and potatoes.You can have a small multi-course meal with a refresco [soda] for $3.50...
 On the inside of the Mercado Hidalgo there are many other great food stands.One of our favorites,a stand my wife and i come back to year after year is the stand of the Hermanos Rodriquez,Juan and Lalo.We were told about Hermanos Rodriquez on our second trip to Guanajuato.We never miss a chance to have a sandwich there for lunch or a snack.I do believe we have successfully tried everything on the menu and can report it is all GREAT.The portians are ample and everything is fresh fresh fresh..you ARE in the middle of the Mercado Hidalgo after all. Maybe $7.50 U.S. for a sanwich,soft drink and "papas fritos" french fries....for two.Learn your spanish words for the meats you like [ham,sausage,chicken] and you are in for a real treat.Say hey to Juan [curley hair] and Lalo.
 Many days we have loaded up for a picnic early at the Mercado [everything gets opened up by about 8:00 a.m.Oh,early in the morning there is a lady that sells fresh tamales..TRY THEM!
 If nothing else the Mercado is a great diversion or place to rest.You can park yourself on the stairs outside and watch Guanajuato move by..."
